business.headline: US stock market: Wall Street dips amid Fed uncertainty and Trump-Putin talksAt the opening bell, the S&P 500 fell 54.92 points, or 0.97%, to 5,620.20, Dow Jones Industrial Average lost 206.06 points, or 0.49%, to 41,635.57, and the Nasdaq Composite decreased 295.45 points, or 1.66%, to 17,513.21.

RBI assures IndusInd Bank customers: 'Bank's financial health remains stable'The RBI has advised depositors and investors not to react to unverified reports regarding IndusInd Bank and instead trust official statements and regulatory updates.

Bengaluru man says Rs 1.5 lakh/month not enough: 'Everything is super inflated'In a recent social media post, a Bengaluru resident mentioned that despite earning a good income, he and his fiancée still live in PG accommodation, unable to afford a decent rental space in the city's expensive housing market.

Sensex settles 1,100 points higher, Nifty above 22,800; Zomato surges 7%Stock market closing today: The S&P BSE Sensex settled 1131.31 points higher at 75,301.26, while the NSE Nifty50 closed over 325.55 points higher to 22,834.30.

Zomato stock price zooms 6% today despite reports of insolvency pleaZomato stock price: Despite the insolvency plea, Zomato shares have not been impacted. They were trading 6.03% higher at Rs 216.15 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE). It had earlier reached an intraday high of Rs 216.50.

Online PF transfer claim rejected? How to apply againEPF claims can be turned down for multiple reasons. Hence, to avoid rejections, employees must carefully review and verify the details before submitting the claim form.

NPCI planning to stop 'collect calls'. Here's whyA collect call, or 'pull' transaction, allows merchants to initiate payment requests from customers. Still, fraudsters tend to exploit this mechanism for the purpose of deceiving others into paying for non-existent goods and services.

Explained: How India can shield itself from Donald Trump's tariff stormCan India escape the fallout of Trump's trade war, or will rising tariffs leave its economy exposed? Here is all you need to know.

Planning to buy land in Mumbai? See what $1 million gets youIn 2014, Rs 8 crore could get you 102 sq m of property in Mumbai, but in 2024, it bought only 99 sq m, according to Knight Frank's 'The Wealth Report'.

LIC hopes to decide on stake in health insurance company by March: ReportIf it enters the health space through a stake purchase, LIC will compete with the likes of Star Health Insurance, Aditya Birla Health Insurance, Niva Bupa Health Insurance and Care Health Insurance.

How EPF balance ensures financial security? 5 benefits to knowA sufficient EPF balance is a safety net in tough times. Though you cannot withdraw all the funds at any given point, you can partially withdraw them for certain needs such as a medical emergency, repayment of a home loan, higher studies, or to meet marriage expenses.

Explained: Why Ola Electric shares gained 14% today after hitting record lowOla Electric share price: The rise comes as investors seem to be buying the dip after yesterday's sharp fall. Trading volumes are higher today, supporting the stock's rebound.

entertainment.headline: Kim Soo-hyun releases new statement on Kim Sae-ron row, denies any wrongdoingKorean star Kim Soo-hyun's team has released a new statement amid the ongoing controversy regarding his alleged involvement in actor Kim Sae-ron's death.

Pakistani actor Danish Taimoor invokes internet's wrath for comments on polygamyPakistani actor Danish Taimoor's recent comments on Islam and polygamy have upset the internet. His controversial take on the concept of having multiple wives has been gathering heat on social media.

Exclusive: Lex Scott Davis on Suits LA, comparisons with original, Harvey's cameoIn Suits LA, Lex Scott Davis plays the role of Erica, a confident woman in a male-dominated world. In an interview with us, Davis teases about Harvey Specter's return to the Suits world.

Suits LA: Harvey Specter is here, but what does his entry bring to the table?Suits LA Episode 4: Harvey Specter has entered the show. However, he is still not on the West Coast yet. How will this new twist bring more excitement to Aaron Korsh's spin-off?

Dupahiya director Sonam Nair on heartland stories, comparison with PanchayatDupahiya director Sonam Nair opens up about the setting of the Prime Video show, comparisons with Panchayat and more in an exclusive interaction.

Kanneda star Parmish Verma on the 'incident' that turned his life upside downActor-singer Parmish Verma spoke to India Today about the time he got shot by a gangster. Verma mentioned how such incidents make you step back and look at your life in a new light.

Shekhar Kapur slams OTT for Bandit Queen's edits: No one asked meFilmmaker Shekhar Kapur recently criticised his film, Bandit Queen's OTT edits. Shekhar wrote about how Indian filmmakers are no less than Western directors.

Jeet Adani on joining Shark Tank India: Don't want to change just 1–2 livesJeet Adani will join Shark Tank India as a mentor for the Devang Special week, focusing on businesses by differently-abled entrepreneurs. He will be joined by the visually impaired entrepreneur Srikanth Bolla.

Pankaj Tripathi says he's 'proud' as daughter Aashi makes debut in music videoPankaj Tripathi's daughter Aashi debuts in the music video Rang Daaro. The music video left her parents emotional. Pankaj called it a proud moment as Aashi began her acting journey.

Rapper Hanumankind meets 'GOAT' Virat Kohli at RCB unbox event. See picRapper Hanumankind recently met Virat Kohli at the RCB unbox event at the Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bengaluru. The rapper shared a picture from the special moment on social media.

Adolescence: Why everyone's talking about this mini-series on NetflixNetflix's Adolescence is earning rave reviews for its gripping one-shot storytelling and stellar performances. Critics and filmmakers like Hansal Mehta call it "next-level storytelling."

iHeartRadio Music Awards 2025: Taylor Swift dominates, Lady Gaga earns honourThe 2025 iHeartRadio Music Awards celebrated top artistes, with Taylor Swift dominating the voted categories. Lady Gaga received a special honour, adding to the night's excitement.

Hania Aamir, Farhan Saeed's Mere Humsafar back on TV: When, where to watchThe popular Pakistani romance drama Mere Humsafar, starring Hania Aamir and Farhan Saeed, is making a comeback. Find out when and where you can watch this beloved series.

Alka Yagnik reacts to Osama bin Laden being her fan: Is it my fault?Alka Yagnik's old interview reacting to Osama bin Laden being her fan has resurfaced. She also spoke about industry politics, revealing how she lost songs to senior singers. Her remarks are now viral.

Former Punjab Chief Minister attends Sidhu Moosewala's brother's 1st birthday bashFormer Punjab Chief Minister Charanjit Singh Channi visited Sidhu Moosewala's home to celebrate the first birthday of the late singer's brother, Shubhdeep. The event, held at Musa village, saw Channi participating in the cake-cutting ceremony.

Malaika Arora scolds contestant for inappropriate danceActor Malaika Arora recently scolded a 16-year-old contestant for his inappropriate dance moves. Malaika asked for the contestant's mother's number.

Hina Khan emotional as boyfriend Rocky calls her a 'brave soul' amid cancer battleActor Hina Khan's boyfriend Rocky Jaiswal recently appeared on Celebrity MasterChef. Rocky spoke about Hina;s cancer battle and called her a 'braveheart.'

Salman Khan's nephew Ayaan on stage name Agni and fighting the nepotism tagBollywood superstar Salman Khan's nephew, Ayaan Agnihotri, recently made his music debut. In an exclusive conversation with India Today Digital, the actor opened up about his stage name and battling the nepotism tag.

Exclusive: Tayme on The White Lotus S3, Lisa of Blackpink, Asian representationTayme Thapthimthong's journey from a real-life security guard to a celebrated actor in The White Lotus Season 3 is truly remarkable. Paired with Blackpink's Lisa, Tayme, in an exclusive chat with India Today speaks about his journey, Asian representation and more.

general news.headline: Sunita Williams's space marathon ends: Back home after 286 days Live UpdatesThe astronauts, part of the Crew-9 mission, ended their spaceflight as they splashed down in the Atlantic Ocean having braved the challenging re-entry through Earth's atmosphere.

Sunita Williams return LIVE: Astronauts splashdown after 286 days in spaceSunita Williams SpaceX Crew-9 Earth Return Live: Sunita Williams's return marks a significant milestone, as her mission was originally intended to last only eight days. However, technical issues with the Boeing Starliner spacecraft necessitated a prolonged stay in orbit.

30-day partial ceasefire, end to Ukraine conflict: What Trump, Putin disccusedAfter telephonic interaction with Donald Trump, Russian President Vladimir Putin has agreed to a 30-day halt on strikes targeting Ukraine's energy infrastructure. The two leader also agreed upon the fresh Ukraine peace talks starting immediately.

45 solo Dubai trips, multiple business ventures: Probe deepens in Ranya Rao caseKannada actor Ranya Rao's arrest in a gold smuggling case has led to a major probe into her financial dealings, alleged hawala transactions, and a widening investigation involving multiple accused.

Video: Moment Sunita Williams splashes down safely after 9 months in space.Sunita Williams and Butch Wilmore safely returned to Earth off the Florida coast, ending a historic mission that extended from an initial eight days to nine months at the International Space Station.

Can gentle parenting ever go mainstream in India?In India, parenting is often seen as synonymous with discipline, limits, and the occasional 'flying chappal'. But can gentle parenting find its place here?

Gold bars, jewellery, luxury watches: Rs 100-crore bust at locked Ahmedabad houseThe raid by Gujarat ATS and DRI led to the recovery of 87.9 kg of gold bars, 19.6 kg of gold jewellery, 11 high-end watches worth crores, and Rs 1.37 crore in cash from a locked apartment in Ahmedabad.

Watch LIVE: Sunita Williams set to splash down after 286 days in spaceSunita Williams return LIVE streaming: Originally launched on June 5, 2024, Williams and Wilmore were part of Boeing's first crewed test flight of the Starliner spacecraft.

Aamir, Gauri Spratt clicked together for 1st time after confirming relationshipActor Aamir Khan and his live-in partner, Gauri Spratt were clicked together in Mumbai for the first time after confirming their relationship. A video of them together has gone viral.

Israel claims attack by Yemen's Houthis, says missiles interceptedAccording to the Israel Defence Forces (IDF), the missile was intercepted by the Israeli Air Force before it could enter Israeli airspace. Residents reported witnessing the interception in the skies.

KKR vs LSG likely to be rescheduled due to security concernsIPL 2025: The match between Kolkata Knight Riders and Lucknow Super Giants on April 6 is likely to be rescheduled due to security concerns. CAB president Snehashish Ganguly has revealed that the Kolkata Police might not be able to provide adequate security at Eden Gardens.

From Ladakh to Lex Fridman, how India-China ties remain under lensBeneath the diplomatic bonhomie lately, challenges persist, particularly over border tensions and China's deepening strategic ties with Pakistan

IPL 2025 Preview: Pat Cummins-led SRH aim to prove 2024 dominance was no flukeSunRisers Hyderabad's ultra-aggressive approach paid off in 2024 as the team reached their first playoffs since the 2020 season. In 2025, SRH's main goal will be to prove that their exploits in the previous season were not a fluke.

Case against Karnataka BJP MLA over vulgar remark against actor Ranya RaoAn FIR was filed against BJP MLA Basangouda Patil Yatnal over his vulgar remark against Kannada actor Ranya Rao, who was caught at the Bengaluru airport with 14.2 kg of gold worth Rs 12.56 crore on March 3.

Impeachment not appropriate: Chief Justice rejects Trump's call to remove judgesTrump described US District Judge James E Boasberg as an unelected "troublemaker and agitator." Boasberg recently issued an order blocking deportation flights under wartime authorities from an 18th century law that Trump invoked to carry out his plans.

After Virat Kohli's criticism, BCCI may rethink family stay policy: SourcesThe Board of Control for Cricket in India may consider relaxing the rules on families accompanying players during overseas tours. The development comes days after Virat Kohli expressed his disappointment with the current policy.

From the India Today archives (2007) | Sunita Williams: The real Ms UniverseAn exclusive conversation from 2007 with Williams, who is on way back to Earth with fellow astronaut Butch Wilmore after an extended stay on the International Space Station

How Sunita Williams's 8-day flight turned into a nine-month struggleShortly after they arrived at the ISS, engineers discovered several critical issues with the spacecraft, including helium leaks and propulsion system malfunctions.

Congress appoints Rajesh Kumar as Bihar unit chief ahead of pollsRajesh Kumar, a Dalit leader and sitting MLA from Kutumba, is known to have close ties with Rahul Gandhi.  He will replace Akhilesh Prasad Singh as Bihar Congress chief.

Vacate Indian territory: Government blasts Pak for remarks on J&K after PM podcastHitting back at Pakistan for its criticism of Prime Minister Narendra Modi's remarks on Pakistan thwarting New Delhi's peace overtures in a podcast with Lex Fridman, India asked Islamabad to vacate Indian territory under its illegal and forcible occupation.

Adolescence: Why everyone's talking about this mini-series on NetflixNetflix's Adolescence is earning rave reviews for its gripping one-shot storytelling and stellar performances. Critics and filmmakers like Hansal Mehta call it "next-level storytelling."

Aurangzeb's tomb isn't in Delhi or Nagpur, but in little-known Khuldabad. Why?A curfew had to be imposed in some areas of Nagpur after protests over Aurangzeb's tomb turned violent. The 17th-century emperor's final resting place isn't in Delhi, the seat of Mughal power, or Ahmednagar, where he died, but in the lesser-known Khuldabad in Maharasthra. Here's why.

Scientists in Antarctica send SOS, report sexual assault, death threats by colleagueScientists at South Africa's Antarctica base sent an email, alleging assault, sexual assault, and death threats from a colleague.
Looking for an affordable SUV? Here are 5 options under Rs 10 lakhThe Tata Punch, Hyundai Exter, Maruti Suzuki Fronx, Skoda Kylaq, and Kia Syros are available for under Rs 10 lakh (ex-showroom).

Bill Gates calls divorce his biggest regret — Melinda Gates has a blunt responseMelinda Gates addressed Bill Gates' regrets about their divorce with a brief comment, highlighting the pain of separation. While Bill expressed remorse, Melinda remains dedicated to her children, philanthropy, and building her future.

Mariah Carey and Anderson .Paak Dating? iHeartRadio Music awards appearance sparks rumoursMariah Carey and Anderson .Paak reignite dating rumours after attending the 2025 iHeartRadio Music Awards together. Meanwhile, Mariah's speech references her past with Tommy Mottola, sparking further discussion about her early career struggles.

Taylor Swift teases Reputation era? Fans decode snake necklace at iHeart Awards 2025Taylor Swift made a surprise virtual appearance at the iHeartRadio Music Awards 2025, sparking speculation about Reputation (Taylor's Version) after wearing a snake choker, a nod to her iconic 2017 album.

Kevin Hart becomes World's highest-paid comedian in 2024, earning $81 millionKevin Hart became the world's highest-paid comedian in 2024, earning $81 million. His diversified portfolio—including films, streaming series, stand-up, and endorsements—helped him surpass stars like Jerry Seinfeld, Tom Cruise, and Hugh Jackman.

sports.headline: NFL: Eagles' Brandon Graham retires after 15 seasons, two Super BowlsA Philly icon hangs up his cleats. Graham, known for his leadership and clutch plays, ends his career as one of the Eagles' most beloved and enduring stars.

KKR vs LSG likely to be rescheduled due to security concernsIPL 2025: The match between Kolkata Knight Riders and Lucknow Super Giants on April 6 is likely to be rescheduled due to security concerns. CAB president Snehashish Ganguly has revealed that the Kolkata Police might not be able to provide adequate security at Eden Gardens.

Women's March Madness gaining success and drawing eyeballsWith household names and thrilling matchups, women's college basketball isn't just keeping pace, It's stealing the spotlight. Rising TV ratings suggest more fans are tuning in than ever before.
Same Game, Different Flavor: How Baseball in Japan Offers a Unique ExperienceFrom stadium cuisine to fan culture, Japanese baseball brings its own distinct energy
Dodgers' Freeman Scratched from Lineup with Rib Discomfort Ahead of Opener vs. CubsL.A. first baseman sidelined as team monitors injury; status for Opening Day uncertain.

Watch: MS Dhoni smacks Pathirana for six with vintage helicopter shortLegendary CSK batter MS Dhoni pulled out his vintage helicopter shot against Matheesha Pathirana in the CSK training. Dhoni smacked Pathirana straight over the bowler's head.

Boxing Federation suspends general secretary Kalita for financial irregularitiesBoxing Federation of India secretary general Hemanta Kalita was suspended on March 18. He was found guilty of financial irregularities.

Indian Superbike League launched: A new era for Indian motorcycle racingWith a vision to harness home-grown talent and elevate the country's motorsports ecosystem, the Indian Superbike League, a franchise-based league, will feature multiple motorcycle classes alongside exemplary racing infrastructure.

NBA: How LeBron James Inspired Mirra Andreeva to win the Indian Wells titleLeBron James inspired Mirra Andreeva to win the Indian Wells title, says his mindset of mental toughness motivated her to win the tournament.

No scars from past: Ponting vows destructive brand of cricket at PBKSPunjab Kings head coach Ricky Ponting has vowed a destructive brand of cricket in Indian Premier League's 2025 season. Ponting has said the current crop of players are new to the team and can play with freedom.
NBA: Unbelievable Austin Reaves went undrafted says Luka Doncic stunned by his scoring streakLuka Doncic stunned by Austin Reaves scoring streak, says it's unbelievable he went undrafted.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
